Package controllers

Class CinemaController

java.lang.Object
controllers.CinemaController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CinemaController extends Object implements Serializable
Controller class that manages the creation of cinemas and their layouts, also saving and loading of the cineplexes
See Also:

    findSeatIndexByStartRowAndCol(Cinema cinema, int row, int col)
    It returns the index of the seat in the seats ArrayList that starts from the specified row and col Returns -1 if no seat begins from that specified row and col If there's a 2-seater from A1-A2, findSeatIndexByStartRowAndCol() returns -1 when row and col corresponding to "A2" is passed, since even though there's technically a seat there, its starting position is not A2 but instead at A1.

  • Method Details

    • getController

      public static CinemaController getController()

    • createCinema

      public void createCinema(String cineplex, int id, Cinema.classType val, int rows, int cols)
      It creates a new cinema object and adds it to the cineplexMap
      Parameters:
      cineplex - The name of the cineplex
      id - Cinema ID
      val - Cinema.classType
      rows - number of rows in the cinema
      cols - number of columns in the cinema

    • listCinema

      public void listCinema()
      For each key in the cineplexMap, print the key, then print the cinemaID of each cinema in the cinemaList

    • getCinemaByIdAndCineplex

      public Cinema getCinemaByIdAndCineplex(int id, String cineplex)
      It takes in a cinema ID and a cineplex name, and returns the corresponding cinema object
      Parameters:
      id - the cinema id
      cineplex - String
      Returns:
      The cinema object with the given id and cineplex.

    • checkCinemaIdExistsInCineplex

      public boolean checkCinemaIdExistsInCineplex(int id, String cineplex)
      It checks if a cinema ID exists in a cineplex
      Parameters:
      id - the cinema id
      cineplex - String

    • defineLayout

      public void defineLayout(Cinema cinema)
      It allows the user to define the layout of the cinema using a UI
      Parameters:
      cinema - the cinema object

    • defineLayoutHelperDefineSeatType

      public void defineLayoutHelperDefineSeatType(Cinema cinema, Seat.seatType sType, boolean defaultLayoutFlag)
      It takes in a cinema object, a seatType enum, and a boolean flag. If the boolean flag is true, it will use a hardcoded array of seat positions to define the layout of the cinema. If the boolean flag is false, it will prompt the user to input a string of seat positions, and then use that string to define the layout of the cinema
      Parameters:
      cinema - the cinema object
      sType - seatType enum
      defaultLayoutFlag - boolean that determines whether the admin wants to use the default layout or not

    • validateDefineLayoutNoClash

      public boolean validateDefineLayoutNoClash(Cinema cinema, String seatPos)
      If the seat is not found in the seating plan, it means it has already been deleted to make way for a 2-seater to the left
      Parameters:
      cinema - the cinema object
      seatPos - The position of the seat to be added.
      Returns:
      The method returns a boolean value.

    • validateDefineLayoutUserInput

      public boolean validateDefineLayoutUserInput(Cinema cinema, String userin)
      It takes a user input string and validates that it has the expected formatting (e.g. "A1 A16 b1 b16") (Logic for validating no clashes is in validateDefineLayoutNoClash())
      Parameters:
      cinema - the cinema object
      userin - "A1 A16 B1 B16"
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value.

    • findSeatIndexByStartRowAndCol

      public int findSeatIndexByStartRowAndCol(Cinema cinema, int row, int col)
      It returns the index of the seat in the seats ArrayList that starts from the specified row and col Returns -1 if no seat begins from that specified row and col If there's a 2-seater from A1-A2, findSeatIndexByStartRowAndCol() returns -1 when row and col corresponding to "A2" is passed, since even though there's technically a seat there, its starting position is not A2 but instead at A1.
      Parameters:
      cinema - The cinema object that contains the seating plan
      row - The row of the seat
      col - The column of the seat
      Returns:
      The index of the seat in the ArrayList.

    • printCinema

      public void printCinema(Cinema cinema)
      It prints the cinema seating plan in a way that is easy to understand
      Parameters:
      cinema - the cinema object

    • saveData

      public static void saveData()
      It saves the cineplexMap object to a file

    • loadData

      public static Object loadData()
      It reads the data from the filepath and returns the data as an object
      Returns:
      The cineplexMap object that is being read from the file.
